p: T-bet, Gata3, Ror-γ, and Foxp3 are specific transcription factors for Th1, Th2, Th17, and Treg cells, respectively. Thus, we detected the protein expression level of specific transcription factors in cultured splenic CD4 + T cells on d 5 in vitro. The protein expression of Gata3 and Foxp3 were increased by 1.54- and 1.69-fold, respectively, but the T-bet and Ror-γ expression were decreased by 0.73- and 0.68-fold in the Pnu group compared with the PBS group ( p< 0.05). Nevertheless, MLA treatment downregulated the Gata3 and Foxp3 expression by 0.80- and 0.65-fold, respectively, while upregulating T-bet and Ror-γ expression by 1.62- and 1.44-fold in the MLA group compared with the PBS group ( p< 0.05). Additionally, inhibiting NF-κB pathway through administering PDTC reduced the expression of T-bet and Ror-γ, whereas inhibiting STAT3 pathway through administering NSC decreased the expression of Gata3 and Foxp3 in the Pnu or MLA group, respectively (Pnu+PDTC versus Pnu, MLA+PDTC versus MLA, Pnu+NSC versus Pnu, MLA+NSC versus MLA, p< 0.05) ( Figure 7b).
